org.jtrim.access

Class RequestGrabber

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.access.RequestGrabber
  • Deprecated. 
    Use boolean properties instead of hacking with this class.

    Allows to acquire and release a specific AccessRequest from an AccessManager. The request and the access manager is specified at construction time and may not be changed later.

    Once an instance of RequestGrabber was created, the acquire() method can be used to acquire the right and disallow requests conflicting the request of the RequestGrabber to be granted to anyone until release() is called.

    Thread safety

    Methods of this class are safe to be accessed from multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this class are not synchronization transparent. Note however, that both the acquire() and release() method returns without blocking and waiting for external events. That is, they can be called from threads which must not be blocked (e.g.: the AWT event dispatch thread).

    @Deprecated
public final class RequestGrabber
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • RequestGrabber

        public RequestGrabber(AccessManager<IDType,RightType> manager,
              AccessRequest<? extends IDType,? extends RightType> request)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a RequestGrabber which will use the specified AccessManager to aquire the specified AccessRequest.
        Type Parameters:
        IDType - the type of the ID requested from the AccessManager
        RightType - the type of the rights which can possible be requested from the AccessManager
        Parameters:
        manager - the AccessManager from which the given AccessRequest is to be acquired. This argument cannot be null.
        request - the request to be acquired by the acquire() method call. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

    • Method Detail

      • acquire

        public void acquire()
        Deprecated. 
        Acquires a scheduled AccessToken from the AccessManager using the AccessRequest specified at construction time. In case the request was already acquired by a previous call to acquire(), this method does nothing but returns immediately. That is, this method is idempotent (if the release() method is not called within the invocations of acquire()).

        After this method returns subsequent conflicting AccessToken requests from the AccessManager will be denied (except for scheduled tokens as those are always granted but in blocked state) until release() is called.

        See Also:
        release()

      • release

        public void release()
        Deprecated. 
        Releases an a previously acquired AccessToken. If the AccessToken was not acquired by a previous acquire() method call (or was already released), this method does nothing but returns immediately. Therefore, this method is idempotent. That is, this method is idempotent (if the acquire() method is not called within the invocations of release()).

        After this method returns subsequent conflicting AccessToken requests from the AccessManager will be granted unless there are other conflicting acquired access tokens (independent from the token of this RequestGrabber or acquire() is called.

        See Also:
        acquire()
